climbs.name: Trails End
climbs.fa: John Andersen and Matt Cochran Summer 2014

content.description: This problem is a highball and commiting. Pull on some obvious good holds and move through the bulge which is the crux. Follow the path of least resistance to top out. With more clean up this problem will be great. Its a little dirty at the moment climbs way better than when you first look at it.
content.protection: 2 crash pads and a spotter makes this a better outing.
content.location: Starts slightly left of the middle of the south face and works up and slightly back right to top out.

content.description: Find the seam/crack in the openbook  and however you can work it to its end at the top.

Likely one of the better boulders along this stretch. This is a giant boulder ( very high on its East side) just as you head up the hill about 10 minutes from the Sylvan Lake Day Use Area Parking Lot.  There are a few problems worth checking out on this block. Curt Love has the obvious V6/7 Seam on the southface indent.
